title: Blackbody - rank power for 4000 K and 8000 K stars

content.question:
StarTemperature <math alttext="kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mtext>K</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>Surface Area <math alttext="meters squared times 10 to the twentieth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>Ã—</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>20</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></math><math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math><math alttext="4000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4000</mn></math><math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math><math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math><math alttext="8000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8000</mn></math><math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math><math alttext="8000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8000</mn></math><math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>
Three stars, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, can be modeled as spherical blackbodies. The surface temperatures and surface areas of the stars are listed in the table. Which of the following correctly ranks the total radiated power <math alttext="P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="P sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="P sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math> of stars <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub X is greater than, P sub Y, which is greater than P sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub X equals, P sub Y, which is greater than P sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub Y is greater than, P sub X, which equals P sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub Y is greater than, P sub Z, which is greater than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than, P sub Z, which is greater than P sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
